subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit:
1. The aim of the Association is to protect from exploitation the young sportsmen and women and to mitigate this risk by advocating for mandatory regulations, through legal frameworks, in accordance with the applicable rules of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child, as well as in accordance with international rules and standards and the existing policies put forward by key stakeholders fighting against child trafficking and other forms of exploitation in sport. 
 
2.    The Association’s mission is to mitigate the exploitation of young sportsmen and women by providing them with education and vocational training, empowering them and their family to make reasonable choices on their potential career in sport, taking into account alternative options of career and the risk of financial exploitation. 
 
3.    The objective of the Association is moreover to ensure that accountability frameworks exist with related regulations, protocols and guidelines, to make certain that stakeholders involved in the development and transfer of young sportsmen and women are kept responsible for the safety and wellbeing of the children in their care.  
 
4.    Simultaneously, the Association will  serve as an observatory of initiatives, activities and decision makings of key stakeholders jointly fighting against trafficking and other forms of exploitation of children.
relevant_communication:
Collaboration with the African Union (Social Affairs Department) to develop a Roadmap to Tackle Child Trafficking in Africa 
 
Contribution of the "Sport Chapter" in the AWERCR mandated Children on the Move in Africa Study (The Maendeleo Report) 
 
Ongoing development of Child Rights & Anti-trafficking Education Mobile App to raise awareness of and educate vulnerable athlete communities  
 
Darfur Initiative (June 2018) - training workshop to educate 50 youth that are internally displaced persons, using the UNCRC as a framework 
 
Upcoming Roundtable Event at the European Commission, hosted by an MEP to address child trafficking in sport.
